item.title: Andrew add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "The world...is full of resurrections... Every night that folds us up in darkness is a death; and those of you that have been out early, and have seen the first of the dawn, will know it - the day rises out of the night like a being that has burst its tomb and escaped into life." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Andrew add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Therefore all that is not beautiful in the beloved, all that comes between and is not of love's kind, must be destroyed." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Andrew add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "Seeing is not believing - it is only seeing." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "We sleep to time's hurdy-gurdy; we wake, if ever we wake, to the silence of God. And then, when we wake to the deep shores of time uncreated, then when the dazzling dark breaks over the far slopes of time, then it's time to toss things, like our reason, and our will; then it's time to break our necks for home. There are no events but thoughts and the heart's hard turning, the heart's slow learning where to love and whom. The rest is merely gossip, and tales for other times." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "I think it would be well, and proper, and obedient, and pure, to grasp your one necessity and not let it go, to dangle from it limp wherever it takes you." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "The secret is not to write about what you love best, but about what you, alone, love at all." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "I had been my whole life a bell, and never knew it until at that moment I was lifted and struck." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Last forever!' Who hasn't prayed that prayer? You were lucky to get it in the first place. The present is a freely given canvas. That it is constantly being ripped apart and washed downstream goes without saying." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets do not go mad; but chess-players do. Mathematicians go mad, and cashiers; but creative artists very seldom. I am not, as will be seen, in any sense attacking logic: I only say that this danger does lie in logic, not in imagination." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Here is the world. Beautiful and terrible things will happen. Don't be afraid." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Believing in him is not the same as believing things about him such as that he was born of a virgin and raised Lazarus from the dead. Instead, it is a matter of giving our hearts to him, of come hell or high water putting our money on him, the way a child believes in a mother or a father, the way a mother or a father believes in a child." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "To be commanded to love God at all, let alone in the wilderness, is like being commanded to be well when we are sick, to sing for joy when we are dying of thirst, to run when our legs are broken. But this is the first and great commandment nonetheless. Even in the wilderness - especially in the wilderness - you shall love him." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Frederick Buechner
item.description: "Turn around and believe that the good news that we are loved is better than we ever dared hope, and that to believe in that good news, to live out of it and toward it, to be in love with that good news, is of all glad things in this world the gladdest thing of all. Amen, and come Lord Jesus." -- Frederick Buechner

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "When despair for the world grows in me and I wake in the night at the least sound in fear of what my life and my children's lives may be, I go and lie down where the wood drake rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds. I come into the peace of wild things who do not tax their lives with forethought of grief. I come into the presence of still water. And I feel above me the day-blind stars waiting with their light. For a time I rest in the grace of the world, and am free." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Wendell Berry

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
